clinical_study.brief_title: Standardization of a Novel Self-administered Tablet Computer-based Clinical Screening Tool for Postoperative Delirium
clinical_study.official_title: Standardization of a Novel Self-administered Tablet Computer-based Clinical Screening Tool for Postoperative Delirium: A Neuropsychological Study in Non-surgical Volunteers

brief_summary.textblock: A common complication after surgery is a temporary state of confusion called postoperative delirium (PD) affecting particularly elder patients. In 2014, a computer program for tablet computers named Delirium Risk Profile (DRP) was developed at the University Hospital Basel to assist preoperative screening. The aim of this study is to generate normative data with cognitively healthy participants for the DRP.

detailed_description.textblock:
A common complication after surgery is a temporary state of confusion called postoperative delirium (PD), affecting particularly elder patients. Prior studies found risk factors for PD, that are present preoperatively, e.g. older age, cognitive impairment, sensory impairment, surgical intervention-related factors, or the postoperative care. However, the preoperative risk of PD is not screened routinely as it is time-consuming and requires trained personnel.
In 2014, the Delirium Risk Profile (DRP), a self-administered computer program for tablet computers, was developed at the University Hospital Basel to assist preoperative screening. It was tested in healthy and cognitively impaired volunteers, as well as in patients undergoing surgery. The aim of this study is to provide normative data for the computer program DRP, and to enable clinicians to administer the DRP as a routinely used tool in the Preoperative Evaluation Clinic.

primary_outcome.description: DRP is a composite score (single value) of self-administered tablet computer-based neuropsychological assessment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Informant Questionnaire on Cognitive Decline in the Elderly (IQCODE)
Consortium to Establish a Registry for Alzheimer's Disease - Neuropsychological Assessment Battery (CERAD-NAB)

intervention.description: The DRP application is administered once to all study participants.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age ≥ 65 years
- Education ≥ 7 years
- Fluency in the German language
- Informed written consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Cognitive impairment (MMS <27 points or IQCODE mean score <3.19 points)
- Signs of depression (GDS score >5 points)
- Participation in a cognitive study within the last 3 months
- Severe sensory impairment (e.g. auditory, visual) making testing difficult
- Severe motor impairment (e.g. essential tremor, paresis, dyskinesia) making testing difficult
- Serious illness of a somatic system (heart, lung, kidneys, endocrine system, gastrointestinal tract)
- Illness of the central nervous system (e.g. M. Parkinson, chorea Huntington, Multiple sclerosis, "stiff-man syndrome", epilepsy, encephalitis, meningitis, etc.)
- Illness or event potentially affecting the central nervous system, in detail: head trauma with loss of consciousness more than 5 minutes, surgical intervention on the brain, general anesthesia within the last 3 months, alcohol dependency, intoxication with cerebro-neurotoxic substances (e.g. butane, etc.)
- Cerebrovascular disease (transient ischemic attack, stroke)
- Regular intake of any psychoactive drug except Tranquilizer
- Previous enrolment into a study using the DRP
